T5.Geo.MapProvider

The MapProvider class is the base class from which all map providers are implemented. The class provides a number of common functions that can be expected in most implementations of a GIS map provider.

Constructor

new T5.Geo.MapProvider(); While the constructor of the map provider takes no initialization parameters it is expected that a derivative MapProvider will implement parameters, and some of these are part of a common set that are read and acted upon when creating the T5.ImageTileGrid that will hold the map tiles in the grid.

Methods

  • checkZoomLevel(zoomLevel)

Return the passed in zoom level if valid for the map provider, otherwise return a zoom level that is valid

  • getCopyright()

Return the copyright message for this map provider

  • getLogoUrl()

Return the url for an image logo that can be used with this map provider

  • getMapTiles(tiler, position, callback)

This is the engine room of a map provider. An implementation of a map provider will provide an implementation of this method to fill a grid of map tiles for the specified tiler at the specified position. The callback that is supplied to the function will be called once a Geo.GeoTileGrid has been created from the map provider and that tilegrid will be passed through as the only parameter to the callback

  • getZoomRange()

Return an object containing the .min and .max for the zoom of the map provider

prepTileGridArgs(width, height, tileSize, center, args)

This method is used by derivative map providers to prepare arguments for a tile grid that it creates when populating the map tiles.

  • setZoomRange(min, max)

Set the min and max zoom range
